Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, probably a column-krater; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of warrior running to right (naked except for greave with added red) and holding spear in right hand and shield (red, seen from inside) on left arm.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 265-6, no. B194)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0129) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
